publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-8059 Des McNulty: Rose Hutcheson, Bankie of the Year—That the Parliament congratulates Rose Hutchison, this year’s Clydebank Citizen of the Year; acknowledges particularly what is considered to be the tremendous contribution made by Rose as a mental health campaigner participating in countless groups helping people with mental illness and those who support them; praises what it sees as her outstanding role in chairing the group, Mental Health Who Cares, with commitment and passion, and applauds what it views as her tenacity and dedication in raising awareness of the issues facing people with mental illness and their carers. Motions and amendments which have attracted additional support

S3M-8059 Des McNulty: Rose Hutcheson, Bankie of the Year—That the Parliament congratulates Rose Hutchison, this year’s Clydebank Citizen of the Year; acknowledges particularly what is considered to be the tremendous contribution made by Rose as a mental health campaigner participating in countless groups helping people with mental illness and those who support them; praises what it sees as her outstanding role in chairing the group, Mental Health Who Cares, with commitment and passion, and applauds what it views as her tenacity and dedication in raising awareness of the issues facing people with mental illness and their carers. Supported by: Jackie Baillie*, Maureen Watt*, Dr Richard Simpson*, Gil Paterson*, Mr Frank McAveety*, Trish Godman*, Mary Mulligan*, Robin Harper*
S3M-8059 Rose Hutcheson, Bankie of the Year (lodged on 3 March 2011) Jamie Hepburn*
S3M-8059 Rose Hutcheson, Bankie of the Year (lodged on 3 March 2011) Stuart McMillan*, Hugh Henry*

S3M-8059 Des McNulty: Rose Hutcheson, Bankie of the Year—That the Parliament congratulates Rose Hutchison, this year’s Clydebank Citizen of the Year; acknowledges particularly what is considered to be the tremendous contribution made by Rose as a mental health campaigner participating in countless groups helping people with mental illness and those who support them; praises what it sees as her outstanding role in chairing the group, Mental Health Who Cares, with commitment and passion, and applauds what it views as her tenacity and dedication in raising awareness of the issues facing people with mental illness and their carers. Supported by: Jackie Baillie, Maureen Watt, Dr Richard Simpson, Gil Paterson, Mr Frank McAveety, Trish Godman, Mary Mulligan, Robin Harper, Jamie Hepburn, Stuart McMillan, Hugh Henry
